dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9682 IH: Preventing Terrorist Entry Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Higgins of Louisiana introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to make inadmissible past representatives or members of terrorist organizations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Preventing Terrorist Entry Act of 2022.

section.header: Inadmissibility of past representatives or members of terrorist organizations
section.text: Section 212(a)(3)(B)(i) (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(3)(B)(i)) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subclause (IV) (in the matter preceding item (aa)), by inserting or has been before a representative;
in subclause (V), by inserting the term or has been before a member; and
in subclause (VI), by inserting the term or has been before a member.
